Scheme_Name: Chief Minister Merit Award
Description: The "Chief Minister Merit Award" scheme launched on 7th May, 2012, by the Adi Dravidar and Tribal Welfare Department, Tamil Nadu, aims to support 1000 boys and 1000 girls belonging to the Adi Dravidar, Tribal, and Adi Dravidar converted to Christianity communities. These students are selected based on their marks in the plus 2 Public Examinations. Each selected student is awarded ₹3,000/- annually for five years, provided they continue their higher education.
Benefits: Financial Support: ₹3,000/- per year for five consecutive years.
Eligibility_Criteria:
The beneficiary should be a resident of Tamil Nadu.
The beneficiary should belong to the Adi Dravidar/ Tribal/ Adi Dravidar converted to Christianity communities.
The beneficiary should have passed plus 2 Public Examination.
The beneficiary should be continuing their studies after plus 2 standards.
Documents_Required:
Proof of identity (Aadhar card or any other document as directed by the authority).
Caste certificate (Adi Dravidar/ Tribal/ Adi Dravidar converted to Christian).
Marksheet of plus 2 Public Examination.Proof of continuing education after 10th standard (admission or enrolment certificate).
Bank account details.
Any other documents (if required).
Application_Process:
1.The interested applicant should collect the application form from the concerned educational institution.
2.In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, paste the passport-sized photograph (signed across, if required), and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest, if required).
3.Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to the educational institution.
4.Request a receipt or acknowledgment from the concerned authority to whom the application has been submitted. Ensure that the receipt contains essential details such as the date and time of submission, and a unique identification number (if applicable).

Scheme_Name: Government-Tuition Fee Concession
Description: The Government of Tamil Nadu provides a Tuition Fee Concession for students belonging to the Scheduled Castes (SC), Scheduled Tribes (ST), and Converted SC/ST Christians communities to promote higher education and alleviate financial barriers.
Benefits: Tuition Fee Exemption: Eligible students are exempted from paying tuition fees in Government and Government-Aided institutions.
Eligibility_Criteria:
1.Community: Applicants must belong to the SC, ST, or Converted SC/ST Christian communities.
2.Parental Annual Income: The annual income of the student's parents or guardians should not exceed ₹2,50,000.
Documents_Required:
1.Community Certificate – Proof of SC/ST status issued by a competent authority.
2.Income Certificate – Valid certificate stating the annual family income does not exceed ₹2,50,000.
3.Aadhaar Card – Copy of the student's Aadhaar card for identity verification.
4.Previous Academic Certificates – Mark sheets and certificates of the last qualified examination.
5.College Admission Proof – Bonafide certificate or admission letter from the educational institution.
6.Bank Account Details – Copy of the student's bank passbook showing account number, IFSC code, and other relevant details.
7.Fee Structure Details – Document from the institution specifying the tuition fees applicable
Application_Process:
1.Obtain Application Form: Collect the tuition fee concession application form from the administrative office of the respective institution.
2.Complete the Form: Fill in the required personal, academic, and financial details accurately.
3.Attach Necessary Documents:
4.Community Certificate: Proof of SC/ST status issued by a competent authority.
5.Income Certificate: Valid income certificate demonstrating that the annual family income does not exceed ₹2,50,000.
6.Submission: Submit the completed application form along with the necessary documents to the scholarship section of the respective institution within the stipulated deadline.
7.Verification: The institution's administration will verify the submitted applications and process the tuition fee exemption accordingly.

Scheme_Name: Free Education (3 years UG Course in Govt. and Govt. Aided Colleges)
Description: The Backward Classes (BC) Free Education Scheme is a financial assistance program aimed at supporting students from BC communities pursuing a 3-year undergraduate degree in Government and Government-Aided Colleges in Tamil Nadu.
Benefits:
Full tuition fee waiver
Exemption from special fees and examination fees
Financial relief for economically weaker students
Eligibility_Criteria:
1.Community: Must belong to the Backward Classes (BC), Most Backward Classes (MBC), or Denotified Communities (DNC).
2.Course Enrollment: Must be admitted to a 3-year UG degree course (B.A., B.Sc., B.Com.).
Institution Type: Should be studying in a Government or Government-Aided Arts and Science College.
3.Residential Status: Must be a resident of Tamil Nadu.
4.Annual Family Income: Should not exceed ₹2,00,000 per annum (may vary as per government norms).
Documents_Required:
1.Community Certificate (BC/MBC/DNC certificate issued by a competent authority)
2.Income Certificate (from the revenue department)
3.Aadhaar Card (or any government-issued ID proof)
4.Proof of Admission (college admission receipt)
5.Previous Academic Records (10th and 12th mark sheets)
6.Bank Account Details (student's bank passbook copy)
7.Domicile Certificate (residence proof of Tamil Nadu)
8.Ration Card Copy (if required for additional verification)
Application_Process:
1.Get the Application Form:
-Available at the college administrative office.
-Downloadable from Tamil Nadu Backward Classes Welfare Department official website.
2.Fill in the Details:
-Enter personal, academic, and financial information carefully.
3.Attach the Required Documents:
-Ensure all documents are correctly attached and self-attested.
4.Submit to College Administration:
-Hand over the application form along with documents to the scholarship section of the college.
5.Verification Process:
-The college administration will verify and forward it to the concerned government department.
6.Approval & Disbursement:
-If approved, the fee waiver will be directly applied to the student's tuition and exam fees.

Scheme_Name: Perarignar Anna Memorial Award
Description: The "Perarignar Anna Memorial Award" launched by the Backward Classes, Most Backward Classes and Minorities Welfare Department, Tamil Nadu, recognizes and rewards academic excellence among boys and girls from the Backward Classes (BC), Most Backward Classes (MBC), and Denotified Communities (DNC) in Tamil Nadu. The award is granted to students achieving the first and second ranks in the 12th Public examination in each district and who continue their education in professional colleges within the state.

The beneficiary should be a student.
The beneficiary should be a resident of Tamil Nadu.
The beneficiary should belong to the Backward Classes (BC).
The beneficiary should secure the first or second ranks in the 12th Public examination in their concerned district.
The beneficiary should be pursuing their studies in professional colleges in Tamil Nadu.
Documents_Required:
Proof of identity (Aadhar card or any other document as directed by the authority).
Caste certificate.
Admission letter or proof of enrollment (Government or Government Aided Arts and Science College).
Previous academic records (as required by the college).
Any other documents (if required).
Application_Process:
1.The interested applicant should collect the application form from their concerned educational institution.
2.In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, paste the passport-sized photograph (signed across, if required), and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest, if required).
3.Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to the institution.
4.Request a receipt or acknowledgment from the concerned authority to whom the application has been submitted. Ensure that the receipt contains essential details such as the date and time of submission, and a unique identification number (if applicable).

Scheme_Name: SC-GOI-PMSS
Description: The Post-Matric Scholarship Scheme for Scheduled Caste (SC) Students (PMS-SC) is a centrally sponsored initiative by the Government of India, designed to provide financial assistance to SC students pursuing post-secondary education. The primary objective is to increase the Gross Enrolment Ratio of SC students in higher education, focusing on those from the poorest households, by alleviating financial barriers.
Benefits:
The scholarship covers various components to support the educational journey of SC students:
1.Maintenance Allowance: Financial support for day scholars and hostellers, varying based on the course group:
--Group I Courses: Degree and Postgraduate level professional courses.
---Hostellers: ₹13,000 per annum
---Day Scholars: ₹7,000 per annum
--Group II Courses: Other professional courses leading to Degree, Diploma, or Certificate.
---Hostellers: ₹9,500 per annum
---Day Scholars: ₹6,500 per annum
--Group III Courses: Graduate and Postgraduate courses not covered under Groups I & II (e.g., B.A, B.Sc., B.Com, M.A, M.Sc., M.Com).
---Hostellers: ₹6,000 per annum
---Day Scholars: ₹3,000 per annum
--Group IV Courses: All post-matriculation (Post Class X level non-degree courses).
---Hostellers: ₹4,000 per annum
---Day Scholars: ₹2,500 per annum
2.Reimbursement of Compulsory Non-Refundable Fees: Covers tuition fees, examination fees, and other compulsory charges payable by the student to the institution.
3.Study Tour Charges: Up to ₹1,600 per annum, provided the study tour is essential for the completion of the course.
4.Thesis Typing/Printing Charges: Up to ₹1,600 for research scholars.
5.Book Allowance for Correspondence Courses: ₹1,200 per annum.
6.Disability Allowance: For students with disabilities, additional allowances are provided as per the guidelines.
Eligibility_Criteria:
1.Community: Applicants must belong to the Scheduled Caste (SC) community.
2.Course Level: Applicable to students pursuing post-matriculation or post-secondary courses recognized by the government.

Scheme_Name: Scholarship (Above VIII Standard) - Tamil Nadu
Description: The Department for the Welfare of Differently Abled Persons, Government of Tamil Nadu, offers the "Scholarship for Students with Disabilities (Above Grade 8)" program. This initiative provides financial assistance to differently-abled students enrolled in government-recognized schools, colleges, or training centers to help with educational expenses.
Benefits:
For students studying from 9th to 12th Standard: ₹4,000/- per annum.
For Degree Courses: ₹6,000/- per annum. 
For Postgraduate, Medical, Engineering, Vocational, and Other Professional Courses: ₹7,000/- per annum.
Eligibility_Criteria:
The beneficiary must be a student.
The beneficiary must be a differently abled person. The beneficiary must be a student of the following courses:
9th to 12th Standard.
Degree Courses:
Postgraduate, Medical, Engineering, Vocational, and Other Professional Courses.
The beneficiary must be differently abled, who are studying in government-recognized schools/colleges/training centers. 
The beneficiary must have obtained not less than 40% of the marks in the previous qualifying examination.
Documents_Required:
Certificates from the head of the institution.
National Identity Card of the Differently Abled.
Statement of Marks (previous qualifying examination).
Application_Process:
1.The interested applicant should visit (during office hours) the District Differently Abled Welfare Officer and request a hard copy of the prescribed format of the application form from the staff exclusively entrusted to issue and collect filled-in applications.
